summary:

He used to be a Project, Programme and Governance Manager with more than six years of successful experience at a major international organisation. He works effectively as a leader or a member a team and can always be relied on to drive strategy, and deliver value-adding solutions promoting growth, profit, and a positive organisational identity.

Below are a selection of key skills and areas of expertise that underpin his accomplishments and success.

• Delivery of new services from idea, design, through definition and implementation to final launch and operations
• Demonstrable expertise in Project Management across changing and ambiguous environments, leading international geographically distributed virtual teams, including client and customer management
• Consistently achieves challenging targets while managing, and tightly controlling, tough budgets
• Excellent strategic vision promoting well-practiced and pragmatic tactical application
• Confident, articulate and persuasive communicator, presenter and negotiator to C-suite level
• Skilled at managing a complex matrix of relationships, networks, and networking opportunities
• Well-developed macro and micro planning, organisational, and resource management abilities 
• Innovative and lateral thinker with excellent analysis and problem solving skills
• Fluent in German and English; conversational Japanese; and basic Dutch, French and Chinese
• Additional keywords: Agile, PRINCE2, service delivery, applications, testing, acceptance, planning, IT, telecommunications, mobile, business change, product development, vendor management, budget management, integration, innovation

profile_positions.description:
As patent examiner, I will work at the forefront of technology and deal every day with the latest and most challenging technical innovations in the field of Telecommunications.

Generally, the daily work of an examiner combines scientific expertise with analytical research and an eye for the legal aspects of intellectual property.

The main tasks of an examiner are to search and examine patent applications received by the EPO. Patent applications are texts and drawings describing an invention and submitted by individuals or companies seeking legal protection.

- The purpose of the search is to find the most relevant previously published technical disclosures ("prior art") against which the patentability of the application can be assessed.

- Substantive examination enables the applicant (or authorised representative such as a patent attorney) to be informed of any objections to the grant of a patent, with a view to resolving these through correspondence and, where necessary, oral proceedings.

- Examiners may also be involved in opposition proceedings if the patent is contested.
